fields.Dialogue Text: The bric-à-brac man looks at you from behind two layers of polished glass. It is nearly impossible to read any emotion. He sways slightly and itches his cheek.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""After I acquired the shop I had a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "After I acquired the shop I had a bit of extra cash on my hands. Could do anything I wanted with it. So what *does* a young man do in that situation?"

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""For a little while. Being cooped u..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "For a little while. Being cooped up alone most of the day wasn't healthy for me... just my own head to consort with. But a friend of mine knew of a way to deal with that."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes. What about it?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes. What about it?"

fields.Title: You: ""I have this commemorative pin, but..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I have this commemorative pin, but before I sell it I have some questions." (Show him Lena's pin.)

fields.Title: You: ""Okay, but can you hold onto it for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay, but can you hold onto it for a few days before putting it up for sale? I promised to give the pin back..."

fields.Dialogue Text: "I rather like it *here* too, so yeah -- I'm not giving you my projector. This tape is all I can do for you and your friends' nightclub project." He nods at the fixed tape on the counter top.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Is it?" He turns his head to the r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Is it?" He turns his head to the right and then to the left, as if looking for non-existent windows. "Spring is capricious, yes."

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "A drug developed by the military to..."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""For the moment, yes.""

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It's about as close to perfection..."

fields.Title: You: ""You jealous, Kim?""

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "It's been through a whole *transfor..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's been through a whole *transformation*. There are so many insights to share -- it just needs a medium. Wouldn't the wake-walkers pay to hear the somniloquy of the spirit light?

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I sure as hell didn't know. All I..."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Man, you're really invested in thi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Man, you're really invested in this." He looks at the bundle of tape in front of him. It shimmers under the shop's dazzling light show.
